flawed_nl_solution:
The 3-year-old dog ages 7 years to one human year so he will technically be 3*7 = <<3*7=21>>21 years old in dog years
Max's dog will be 21 when Max turns 3 so the age difference is 21-3 = <<21-3=81>>81

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 18, not 81. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
